subject: Re: [junit] subroutins with junit?
msgSnippet: ... Well, how about something simple? public void testGetBoisson() { Container foo = new Container();  // do whatever you need to create foo. int input = 0;
messageBody:
On Thu, 3 May 2001, haddad.othman@... wrote:

> i don't know how to test a subroutin by junit!
> example a function that implements another function from
> another class and doesn't make anything alse.
> for instance:
> //the subroutin getBoisson is in the class Container
> public int getBoisson(int choix)
> { Machine.receiveBoisson(choix);
> //receiveBoisson is a function in Machine.
> }

Well, how about something simple?

public void testGetBoisson() {
Container foo = new Container(); // do whatever you need to create foo.
int input = 0;
int expected = 42; // replace with expected value
int actual = foo.getBoisson(input);
assertEquals( "Input " + input +
" expected " + expected +
" but got " + actual,
expected, actual );
}

(I wouldn't right it exactly this way, I've used smelly temporary
variables to make my intent clearer. I wouldn't indent it this way,
either, but you know how mail clients can be...)

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
